name: Nick Dawg
text: Was hired by these gents for a position of Florence housing authority in a small community. Was supposed to be 1-8. Got changed to 1-5 immediately after my first week. It is very hot in Florence Alabama in case you didn’t know. Was trained by a good person. However there is a language barrier. Furthermore the community of which I was cleaning was for the most part.. okay. However after picking up bags and towels filled with human feces. Had to quit. No notice. Nothing. Absolutely absurd. If I wanted to clean human feces I would’ve looked for plumbing positions. Good day.

name: Ronald Thurston
text: Your new receptionist is awesome! I don't wanna misspell her name but Kajari.. she was knowledgeable, attentive and obviously ment to be in a customer interaction roll, I have more than 15 years of customer service experience and she wowed me! The process was quick and easy. I start tomorrow. Thank you!

name: Kim Santos
text: Cheryl Datuin is amazing. Very professional and helpful.

name: Robin Edgil
text:
I made looking for a job my full time job. I filled out dozens of applications over a two month period. I applied online to well over 100 employers. I only had two interviews during this time.

I made a decision to call a staffing agency and randomly chose Elwood. I called them on a Friday, they immediately had me complete an application, and by Monday morning, I had a job!

Ana and Jessica are so thorough! They're fast and professional. I would recommend this agency to anyone who needs work fast! Very pleased!

name: Tony Brocato
text: Elwood has been very helpful in finding us quality employees.

name: Marilyn Hutto
text: In November 2019 I was looking for employment. Elwood Staffing had helped my daughter find employment awhile back and she was very happy with them.  I went in and tested, filled out paperwork and they called me a few days later. I interviewed with my current employer (Insurance agency) and they hired me right away.  I love my job.  I am very pleased with the staff of Elwood Staffing. They followed up with me and made sure I was satisfied with my job. If I ever need another job I will without a doubt call on the staff at Elwood Staffing. I am very confident they will show me every professional effort possible. I give them a high 5 in every way.

name: Tommy Cummings
text: Very please with our experience with Elwood staffing.  Very professional and prompt.  I would highly recommend them.

name: Brigette Bridges
text: Great people committed to finding employment for you!

name: Steven Haynes
text: This place is a joke. They tried to lock me in the building and wouldn’t let me leave. They were highly unprofessional and I wouldn’t recommend this place. I’ve never had an issue with getting a job before til now.

name: Darrin Whorton
text: Great staff, very helpful,  courteous.

name: Art Of Valor
text: It's all a scam. All they care about is the money they make for themselves. They make bank while making sure the working man stays at the bottom. If you get hurt in an on the job accident, trust me, they will leave you out to dry. Temp agencies as a whole should be shut down. The workers are always the ones who get screwed in the end. I give one star because zero or negative isn't an option.

name: Deidra Cromer
text: Great company! TempForce works very hard to place each employee with a perfect fitting employer. TempForce is not your everyday contract employee company, they go above and beyond to make sure each need is met! The workers at TempForce are kind and easy to talk to, which makes job placement a better experience.

name: Kimberly Ware
text: I've been in their system for about 18 years, and I have NEVER received one phone call from them about a job. I have seen where they advertised jobs in the local paper, but when I called to inquire about the jobs, I was always told that they don't have anything available. This goes on every time I call.

name: Josh Brasher
text: TempForce is a great company!  We have never been disappointed in anything we have tasked them to do for us.  If you are looking for a staffing company to help fill your needs, this is the one for you!

name: Chelsea Haggard
text: I accidentally applied to temp force and i am so glad I did. I got a call almost immediately after I applied asking for me to come in and speak with them. I had to take a few tests in writing and on the computer. After I finished, I was told that I would get a call soon. I got called in for an interview two days later and got offered a job the day I interviewed. My experience with temp force was amazing considering I had a job within a week. I would definitely recommend them to anyone.

name: Kim Martin
text: Great company with a great staff that will work with you to find the employees to meet the needs of your company.

name: Johan Duff
text: Not great,  just not that great I was left not getting much from them. Very start to the point with me and just not great. I really feel like I wasted my time going there. That’s just me. Anyway

name: Sandy Pierce
text: Temp Force is the greatest company to work with.  We hire all of our temps through Temp Force

name: Jeune Gwen
text: The agents there are very friendly and do call frequently to try to place you in a job. The process isn't the best though. I've just moved here from Florida, and the staffing places there interview you in the office and if they feel you are a fit, they give you the information you need to start with that company and tell you when to show up. The actual companies don't interview you. However with Tempforce, I had to interview with the agents, interview with the company, then had to go back to Tempforce to tell them the questions I was asked in the interview. It was honestly a waste of time for me, and I'm sure for everyone else. After a while you start to get tired of getting called for interviews every week instead of an actual job.

name: Star Fox
text: Low wage jobs that you'll hate. Don't support this agency.

name: brittany jemison
text: Worse place to ever apply at . Will be contacting eeoc on them ASAP!

name: Hunter Grogg
text: Had a job after 2 days im so thankful...Thank you tempforce!

name: William Frost
text: They are good about finding you a job

text: One job In nine months..  Temp agencies are keeping blacks out of jobs in Alabama..  I have called the eeoc

text: They never have anything available and cater to a certain crowd

text: I recently moved back to the area and have been trying to find a job, I have tried finding jobs on Indeed, but have not had any positive feedback. I highly recommend Express Employment Professionals and the whole Decatur team!!

text: I’m glad that I called Express Pros, they were very determined to find me a job that I love and enjoy very much. They answered all my questions that I had, I would definitely recommend Express to anyone who is looking for a job. They really care about what your looking for in a job and will go the extra mile to find the job for you....Thank You Express!

resp.text: Jerome,  THANK YOU. You're such a pleasure to work with, and we're glad things are going well at C&C.  Dont forget we pay referral bonuses - we need more hard-working dedicated associates like you!!

text: The staff was very thorough and understanding of mine and every other person’s work experience. It was a step-by-step process that they executed with professionalism. Very great service!

resp.text: Noel, Thank you for your kind words.  It's associates like yourself that make our job so easy.  We know you will have great success in your next role.

name: Sheronda Boughknight
text: Very professional. Love everyone's attitude that works in the office. Everyone is very helpful and care. I give them all 5 stars way better then other staffing locations for sure! Thanks Express Employment of Decatur Al for giving me a opportunity in the workforce.

resp.text: Thank you Sheronda.  We've been blessed with fantastic associates like you, that make our jobs easy and fun.  We appreciate all your hard work, and looking forward to hearing about your success.

text: The staff that works here only helps the people that they want to help theres this one staff named Kimberly helped her own cousin returned back to work but here I am and others are still unemployed. I need to get the department of labor involved with this

name: Christy Nichole Goodman
text: I absolutely love the kind, helpful, resourceful people they have, & the time to they take to make sure we are pleased.

name: Robert Harkins
text: They were very helpful and concerns and caring....

name: Melissa Austin
text: Amy Odom has been the best person to help anyway she can. She goes above and beyond to be help you. Thank you so much

name: Amanda Craft
text: Very helpful place when you are looking for a job!

name: Forrest Weeks
text: I have used Snelling over the last 4-5 years to help us fill professional positions.  The team is top notch and they have delivered us great candidates every time.  Using Snelling has allowed us to keep the focus on our business and our customers while trusting Snelling to fill our critical vacancies.  I strongly recommend this business.

name: Nadia Mathieu
text: I have been working for Snelling for about 5 months and I have had nothing but great experiences. They matched my experiences and skillset with a great company to work for. Snelling staff and owner have been very communicative and helpful. Absolutely no complaints.

name: Sue Ann Sandifer
text: Hollye Hatfield and the team at Snelling of Huntsville have been very professional, responsive and extremely helpful to me. I highly recommend their staffing agency.

name: Shakia Williams
text: The ladies here are a pleasure to work with. Everyone's friendly and they are very responsive. Debbie has always been a great help!

name: Susan Huthcens
text: Courteous staff and was great landing me with the job I had been searching for some time!

name: Britney Mitchell
text: If I could give this company more that 5 stars I would! They are the most professional, respectful, and welcoming temp services ever! I had never been to a temp service before so I really didn't know what to expect. Snelling has set the bar high and I think other temp service agencies could learn a few things from them. They made me feel welcome and made my process so quick and easy.When ever I had a question or concern they helped me immediately! I could go on and on about this exceptional company but I would like for anyone that is in need of a job or career and is thinking of going through a temp services I HIGHLY recommend Snelling. I for sure will be send referrals to this wonderful company.

name: Tammy Hyatt
text: I sent my resume to the fantastic ladies at Snelling and had a job interview within days!  I’m now employed and couldn’t be happier! Thanks Snelling!

name: Koren Robinson
text: The staff here have been wonderful, they worked hard to find an assignment for me that turned to a permanent position! Kathryn and Hollye were great to work with!

name: Fern Thompson
text: Awesome experience with this great Snelling staff and job placement! They are professional, friendly, efficient, and fast! Within three weeks they opened doors, set up an interview, processed new hire paperwork, and even checked up on the first day jitters. Above and beyond all expectations! A special thank you to Tammy Pruitt and Leigh Butgereit! Your help, kindness, and  extra efforts will not be forgotten. Kudos to Snelling for employing such great professionals!

name: Amy Quinones
text: I had an amazing experience working with the talented team at Snelling!  They were quick to answer any questions I had and they found me a placement within a very short time!  I truly felt like one of the family immediately. I would recommend (and have!) anyone working with them.

name: Giga Parts
text: We've been using Snelling of Huntsville for several years for temps and permanent employees and we have always been impressed with their professionalism and willingness to help. Hiring through Snelling reduces the amount of time we spend on recruiting and interviewing and reduces the cost of turnover. They go out of their way to understand our needs and to exceed our expectations every time. I can't say enough good things about them!

name: David Kelly
text: Working with Snelling has been one of the best experiences I’ve had with a recruiting firm.  Snelling did not take a typical job order.  They went above and beyond to understand the culture of our organization, the focus of how we go to market, and the level of talent we expected out of our partnership.  Snelling did not disappoint.  I experienced a true partnership with the recruiter I worked with.  She took it so seriously and made the time to visit our facility and learn more about our company and how we go to market.  This level of customer service exceeded my expectations.

name: Kippie Salter
text:
Snelling of Huntsville has truly blessed me with their qualified, understanding personnel. I received immediate placement in a position that is a lifetime opportunity for me!!  I had been trying to find employment for months through online resources without any success. Within 1 day Snelling of Huntsville had me in a position that I consider to be ideal. Tammie, Debbie, and Leigh have been available in such a professional, courteous manner that I know regardless of any issues that might occur they are going to help me succeed!! Sincere thanks to all the staff at Snelling of Huntsville, you are the best!!
Respectfully,
Kippie Salter

name: Donna Lasseter
text: The people are very friendly

name: Monte “Coach” Miller
text: Solid communication even during a buyout.

name: Kelly G.
text: Had a great experience with Huntsville Snelling! The staff is helpful, professional and responsive. Would definitely recommend them to anyone seeking short-term or long-term employment. They do a tremendous job with matching skills and experience with the appropriate company. Excellent for individuals looking to become familiar with the Huntsville job market.

name: Joshua White
text: Snelling has a long relation with our firm. We consistently get staff from them who meet our needs and possess the perfect skill-sets. Snelling takes the time to listen to what we need and send over people who have good attitudes and are good fits in our environment. Highly recommended.

name: Chelsea Hughes
text: My experience with Snelling was great. Every employee that I spoke with on the phone or met with at the office was very friendly and helpful. It took a little patience up front, but Kathryn Brashier lined up a couple of great interviews and one that was a perfect for me, that led to a permanent position. Everyone was quick to respond to emails if I had a question, and followed through with me. I looked for a job for months before getting with Snelling, and they made it happen.

name: Dinah B.
text: Snelling was awesome in finding employment in my line of experience, Tammy and Debbie are really great with my experience in being hired through Snelling I would recommend any body to go with them. They helped me find a job as soon as I moved here and it was in my profession. I give Snelling 10 stars if I could all good experience with them on my end.

name: Deb Kasper
text: I have been working for Snelling for 2 years and have been wonderfully satisfied with them. Hollye Hatfield has been great! She looks out for me, always finding great assignments, and compliments me to clients. She's very kind and helpful. I consider her a friend. The company pays well, is well organized, and the staff answers questions almost immediately and they do whatever it takes to address/answer your question. I highly recommend Snelling - and especially Hollye!

name: George Justiniano
text: I could not be more happier with my experience with Snelling. I thought I was happily employed before prior to my current position, but Pam had other ideas. She scheduled an interview for me and I could not believe how thankful I was to hear her out and attend the interview. Throughout the whole process she made herself available at all times and was very helpful and professional. I am now even happier than I was before and highly recommend Pam and her team. They are second to none!

name: Krystal Sprague
text: I moved to Huntsville from TN and slowly found my way to Snelling. It didn't take very long for them to contact me nor help me find placement with a job! Everyone was very nice and encouraging. Tammy was very uplifting. I have recommended these ladies and will continue to do so!

name: Selena Jefferson
text: Snelling is a great company! Had an interview and got a call back the next day. Very fast process, i start my new job on Monday. So excited!

name: sonja Spencer
text: Snelling has been great and Hollye is by far the best boss I have ever had

name: Brittany Jones
text: This is a wonderful company to work for; Snelling has found me the job of my dreams!! Tammy Pruitt was courteous, kind, and so professional, she found me the perfect job that i just fit right in with. I can honestly say that because of Snelling i enjoy going to work every single day!!!

name: Deborah Burke
text: This was my first experience with a staffing agency and I'm glad I chose Snelling.  Their entire team is professional and patient (I had A LOT of questions) and they obviously care about their employees.  Best of all - Hollye matched me with the perfect position!  I highly recommend Snelling Staffing Services.

name: Diane Tyler
text: The staff at Snelling are some of the most pleasant humans I have ever worked with..from the front desk on back!  Working with Snelling has been an extraordinary and unusual experience for me when it comes to staffing agencies.  Looking for a job is unnerving at any age and the staff there put me at ease.   Thank you Snelling Huntsville!

name: Jessica Beckling
text: I came to Snelling because I needed to find employment after being out of the workforce for some time. The whole staff was excellent in helping me find exactly what I wanted. If you are looking for a job, I highly recommend you start here...

name: Beverly Holcomb
text: Excellent company to work with and work for! Tammy not only helped me find a job quickly but one that I am truly excited about! Highly recommend!

name: Amber Pearman
text: My experience with Snelling was fantastic. Kathryn consistently communicated with me and kept me informed throughout the whole direct hire process. I would highly recommend this staffing company to anyone looking for employment.

name: Jason Zarrilli
text: Fast, efficient and attentive. We have hired multiple employees that started as temporary workers from Snelling and all are a vital part of our team. Highly recommended and by far the best staffing agency in Huntsville.

name: Christy Reinhardt
text:
Paul and his team do a great job of understanding my needs and matching appropriate resources to those needs.  The Snelling team is also easy to do business with and works as a partner with our business.

Jason Reinhardt
CFO
Synapse Wireless, Inc.

name: Steve MZ
text: Very impressive.   They found me a job I love, prepared me for the interview, and I was offered the job at the end of the first interview.  Great experience and made an easy transition from military to civilian.

name: Sherry Floyd
text: Kathryn Brashier and her team are professional and courteous; all working to find solutions and exceed expectations.  I would highly recommend the Huntsville Office for future staffing needs!

name: Cindy Peck
text:
I can't say enough good things about Wendy Colescott, Executive Recruiter for Banking and Financial Services at Snelling of Huntsville.

I had just moved to Huntsville from my life long home, Oklahoma City and for the first time, since I was 15 years old, I found myself without a job.  Banking has been my career for 28 years and I love it so.  I asked to connect with Wendy though LinkedIn and she immediately accepted and requested my resume and set a time to talk.  After our talk she immediately went to work reaching out to clients of Snelling to see if they had a need for anyone with my skill set.  Within just a few days, she had an appointment set for a meet and greet with a bank here in Huntsville.  For 3 weeks Wendy kept in touch with me to see how my search was going and she would also let me know of her continued efforts.

Wendy was the first person that I met in my new city.  Even though Snelling was not able to find a place for me, I still feel that Wendy and  Snelling set the stage for how great Huntsville is.

Thank you Wendy! I am truly grateful.  You are a ROCK STAR in Rocket City!

Cindy Peck

name: Amy Melton
text: Upon moving to Huntsville, I had every intention of remaining with Snelling as a Temp Agent because of the flexibility.  Having an assignment with clients who were immediately like family changed my mind.  While I enjoyed "M'Amy time" with my grandchildren, I wasn't about to pass up the opportunity to work with another wonderful company.  We're so compatible and never thought that I would be happy anywhere other than Snelling.  Thanks, Hollye, for placing me with the P-E-R-F-E-C-T business!!!

name: Jeff Nix
text:
When I met with the recruiter I explained my past employment history (over 20 years of sales experience with 13 years as an Regional Sales Manager) after our meeting it seemed positive and she seemed very optimistic in finding me employment.
That was a joke, after a week I sent several emails and made several phone calls either going straight to voice mail or being told she is on the phone and will call you back,  I would patiently wait a week or two with no response.
Also I was told to email the recruiter employers that I showed interest and met their qualifications before I alpplied since Snelling  needed to be the first source of contact I would've better off emailing Mickey Mouse.
Now I've missed my chance with the positions expecting her to make contact.

Don't waste your time!!!

resp.text:
My name is Paul Brashier and I own the Snelling Search and Staffing firm located in Huntsville. We take feedback from our clients and our candidates seriously so I wanted to respond to Mr. Nix’s comments. Prior to his posting this review, I spoke with Mr. Nix on the phone to better understand and apologize for his issues.

Our firm has been serving our clients for over 50 years. Snelling of Huntsville has consistently been recognized within the top 2% of firms in our industry for outstanding customer service and we are a founding member of the North Alabama Better Business Bureau with an A+ rating. We were a finalist for “Best Places to Work” for the last three years. We are consistently one of the top 5 performing franchises in the Snelling network nationally. Our business is client driven so our focus is on identifying and recruiting great talent for our clients that will help their businesses succeed. While we certainly can’t profess to pleasing all people all of the time, our performance and recognition support that we have a great team that takes great care of our clients and our candidates.

name: Louis Michetti
text: I recently found myself looking for a new job after my position was eliminated. After being employed for 30 years it was very intimidating looking for a new job.  So many things had changed over the years.  I met with Paul and he immediately put my mind at ease.  He introduced me to Wendy. She was extremely helpful, professional, knowledgeable and showed complete understood my situation. We immediately hit it off and she went to work.  I have to say working with Paul and Wendy was very easy and one of the most rewarding professional experiences of my career.

name: Cyrena Hodges
text: Snelling-Huntsville is a great company to work with.  I have worked with Hollye Hatfield for 10+ years.  She is always professional, and her level of customer service and satisfaction always exceeds my expectations.

name: Ashley mackey
text: Snelling is the perfect staffing agency professionals who are serious about finding a great fit! The entire staff is kind and professional. Hollye was my recruiter and she was so nice and helpful even after I was placed.

name: Angela Thornberry
text: Professional. Friendly. Eager to help. Do not mind getting calls. They check up on me to see how I like my job. Answer all my questions.

name: Shkeler Atchison
text: I like to thank Snelling for the great opportunity they found for me at a great company. Ms. Tammy Pruitt showed concerned and committment to finding me a job. She just did not find me anything, but a job where I had received training in Medical Billing  and Coding.  If there were more people in this world who cared about others, like Ms. Pruitt, the world would be more loving and kind.  She takes her job seriously and for me she is a great asset to Snelling. There may be alot of events in my life I will forget, but speaking with Ms. Tammy Pruitt will not be one.

name: Renee Gurley
text: Kathryn Brashier and her Snelling team placed me with an amazing company. I do not feel like a candidate with Snelling, I feel like a part of the family.

name: Lori Norwood
text: Hollye was wonderful.  Took a traumatic experience for me and turned it into a huge positive.   I don’t have enough good words to say about Snelling in Huntsville.

name: Chasity Arnold
text: I spoke with Tammy and was assured I would be up for a position. I had to constantly call/email and check the status of my application. She said she would be getting back to me, but I never heard back from her. I emailed her once more, just be certain. No response. I hate that I had a negative experience with this company.

resp.text:
We take feedback from our clients and candidates seriously so I wanted to respond to Ms. Arnold’s comments. I have spoken with Ms. Arnold to apologize for any confusion on our part and to let her know that she continues to be candidate for roles with our clients where her qualifications meet the client’s needs.
Snelling of Huntsville has been serving our clients for over 52 years and we consistently rank among the top 2% of firms in our industry for outstanding customer service. We are a founding member of the Better Business Bureau of North Alabama with an A+ rating. Our business is client driven so our focus is on identifying and recruiting great talent for our clients that will best meet their needs and help them succeed. While we wish we could place 100% of the 100’s of candidates that we receive each week, that is simply not possible, nor is it possible to contact everyone to let them know we don’t have a suitable opportunity right now. But, we will keep trying!

name: Latika Mccrary
text: You can be qualified for positions at Snelling and all you ever hear is; "We have your application on file".  Never a return call even when you are told they will call you because you have great experience!

resp.text:
We do not have anyone by the name Latika McCrary in our applicant tracking system so we have been unable to contact this reviewer. Perhaps this is an alias. Ms. McCrary, if you would like to speak with the owners directly, please call our office and ask for Paul or Kathryn and tell them the reason for your call. We would be happy to hear from you directly.
At Snelling of Huntsville, we help our clients by recruiting great talent that matches their needs. Our clients typically make the decision about which candidate to hire. We have great candidates that are highly qualified that we are sometimes not able to place in an assignment because we do not have the right opportunity for a candidate's great experience in the compensation range they desire. We would put every candidate that applies to our opportunities to work if we possibly could. Unfortunately, we don't always have the right opportunities and it isn't financially feasible to have an employee personally call every candidate that we are unable to employ.

name: Amanda Wilson
text: I’m let down. Snelling is good at finding you jobs and recently found a error of why I didn’t get paid and fixed right away, it is a professional environment . They sent me to a great work place but a issue happened that seems very one sided . I was let go: I am a hard worker , I have wrote out to tammy asking her if she could help with another job because the job I was given apparently not what God intended me to have so.. Tammy if you see this , you could have emailed back and said you couldn’t help or no jobs right now, I’ve been left hanging ... maybe you have your reason but I can’t bash you guys. You definitely are a great staffing place and people I’ve talked too went through you guys and been at their jobs you got them for years : I wrote a long message on what happened and my side of it all. Remember 3 sides 1. Yours 2. Theirs 3. Truth. Just guess I’m severely let down that I passed up 2 jobs because I dedicated myself to you guys . I thought I would get the same respect

name: Matt Watkins
text: My experience with Snelling was great. I dealt with MJ. She is on point with everything, very responsive, and found a great company for me that I am still with two years later.

name: Jonathan Goodwin

He got me an interview with a local CPA firm and even did a mock interview with me to prepare. I nailed it and have been happily excelling at this CPA firm for nearly 2 years now. Paul helped change my life for the better and I will always be greatful that he found the time to work with me.

The lady on the phone also told me that they would find me something else and call me. That was 4 years ago. I never got another call from them. Total waste of time.

resp.text: Don't you find it funny that the person writing this review would not initially identify themselves. We have not placed for Topre since 2012 yet this was posted just a few months ago. We liked the "Johnny Shades" code name first used. Hope Johnny, I mean Sidney,  learns not to wear "shades" to an interview or orientation in the future.

text: I would not recommend this place for a job When I left work Saturday everything was ok but when I got to work Monday they said they didn’t need my service no more they could have told me that Saturday then on top of that after working all day Saturday they only paid me $ 8.00 they steal your money do not go there looking for a job

name: Ayanna Whiting
text: After gaming employment with this company at a Law Firm, I was offered a PERMANENT better paying and better opportunities at a new job I applied for MONTHS before gaining employment with Aspire. I attempted to turn my 2 week notice in to owner MARK, and he distatsefully told me that I had absolutely no business applying for jobs when I was already employed through his company. His assistant Miss Sherry apologized on his behalf and stated he was simply “having a bad day”. However on multiple occasions he has been snappy rude and extremely UNPROFESSIONAL. I was told by him that I could call my new job and tell them I could start today as he did not want me to complete remainder 2 weeks of my notice. This company and Mark are known for UNPROFESSIONAL business as well as bounced payroll. I was able to turn in a two week notice to the Law Firm where I was placed  I let their HR know about the experience I had with this company & they also apologized and stated that this was not the first time employees were treated unprofessional by Mark. I wish I could give negative ratings because he is the absolute worst employer I have ever encountered.

name: Tracy Jensen
text: This is the single worst place I have ever worked with. If I could give it minus stars I would. Mark is extremely unprofessional and should not be in the customer service business. He does not know how to treat people with respect. I recently had the unfortunate circumstance of getting a job through him. He made the job out to be the best job for me. Come to find out it was not a job I was comfortable doing and decided not to accept it. When I called to let Mark know my decision and why he was extremely rude, told me he would not work with me anymore and hung up on me. Needless to say I was flabbergasted that a so-called professional could act that way. DO NOT go to Aspire Staffing to find a job!

name: M D B
text: Avoid using them for the staffing of your business.  Very unprofessional and unable to retain talent.  Several other local agencies are able to do a better job.

name: Rebecca
text: The staffing members are very professional, and have been supportive through my job search. Only a week after submitting my resume to Aspire, I was asked to be a temp by a great company.... only to be hired for a permanent position! I'll recommend Aspire to everyone.

name: Kendall Wright
text: Don’t waste your time going to Aspire Staffing! The owner is rude, very rude! I started a job and only went to the job two days because of health issues. I was told I would be paid $13 an hour, but when i got my check for two days (13 hours) it was $34 and they changed the pay to minimum wage. I went back into the office to ask about the pay and I was told that there policy stated if a person quits (I didn’t quit I was rudley told by Mark not to go back) then they can change their pay back to minimum wage. I asked the white older woman in the office to show me that in documentation, she couldn’t do that and after a while started asking me “do you want me to just give you $5 of my money?”... Moral of the story, this place is a very unprofessional business! I would NEVER recommend anybody coming here!

text: Came in Thursday afternoon, filled out paper work, and start my new job Monday! Very friendly and helpful. I was surprised about how quick they were able to find a job for me.

text: My experience was horrible. I intended to give them a half a star. The receptionist is very rude and sarcastic. I called in to complain about my emergency contact being called for situations that were clearly not an emergency and given my personal information. He raddled off a few snippy remarks and quickly hung up the phone. There's a lot more but I don't want this to be too long and drawn out. They need customer service training asap.

name: Kelli Schofield
text:
I haven't had much experience with this place but I recently received an email from them essentially telling me I lied on my application. They told me I had no experience and that I should only apply to jobs I am qualified for. My experience was clearly listed in my resume. Perhaps it turned out not to be the exact kind of experience they were looking for, but they told me I did not have "ANY" experience-- and yeah they capitalized it like that. It was rude and unnecessary. Like, just don't respond to my application then, buddy.
For context, they wanted experience handling medical records and I've only handled veterinary records. Still medical records... excuse the hell out of me.

name: Amanda
text: As if it isn’t allready frustrating enough that I lost my job before the holidays, been job searching on multiple search engines with multiple logins and passwords to manage and keep up with for the past 3.5 weeks, but this career center in CULLMAN COUNTY can’t even fix a small issue where dates align on resume when printed but aren’t aligned on resume when uploaded to the Alabama joblink website. How is it this place has been here in this city since I know when I was a child but they can’t even come up with a troubleshoot solution??? You get paid to help the community of CULLMAN. Any individual should be able to come in, let you update their resume, correctly. name: Michael Intregila
text: Where do you pick up the pieces as you transition from the military to the civilian world?  It can be extremely difficult to translate what your skill set encompasses and relay that to a company.  Add the fact that you have a family to provide for, along with the other stresses of life and you have a cocktail of uncertainty.  Kara is more than just a third party recruiter; she's a coach, a mentor, a teacher.  We take for granted the soft skills a person might have, but when it comes down to it, they are more important than you could ever imagine.  Kara embodies the process.  Understanding not only your credentials, but who you are as a person.  It's what you don't see, the actions behind the curtain that make Kara a force to be reckoned with.  Countless hours devoted to her clients to ensure the next job is not just a job, but a path to success; a career path the answer your 1 year, 5 year, 20 year + plan.  It is an amazing feeling to know deep down in your heart that you will be taken care of.  I owe everything to Kara and her work she has done.  Much like artwork, she will paint a picture of what your life's work truly can become when given the right opportunities.  Kara deserves the strongest recommendation because Kara knows me as a person.  She knows my hopes, my dreams and above all my future work needs.  Go to a recruiter if you need a new job.  Go to Kara if you'd like to know how to be successful for the rest of your life.

resp.text: Thank you Michael, we appreciate your support and allowing us the opportunity to work with you! Congratulations on your new career opportunity!

text: Be sure you carefully look over your employment agreement before you sign.    Make sure that what they told you verbally, is what is written on your documents. text: Completely unprofessional. Amanda, thank you for screwing me over and getting my REFERENCE a job and tossing me to the wind.  I refuse to even get an email.  The aerotek in Texas was sued for lack of payments to their workers,  and here,  they don't care about anyone but themselves.

name: Khalil Withrow
text: I was helped out of a tight spot after moving to Huntsville by Aerotek. Eric Horton and Andy Buckner made sure I was given an opportunity, and it's been the biggest turn for me.

name: Nicholas Aspey
text:
They'll get you hired quickly, but afterwards it's like pulling teeth to get anything from them.  They have been duplicitous and obfuscatory in almost every encounter.  Per my contract I was to receive a set number of paid holidays at specific times - when the first holiday's pay was missing, it took two weeks and repeated calls to get the matter resolved.  A co-worker of mine who has the misfortune of also being contracted via Aerotek was repeatedly told over the phone that his contract did not cover holidays nor allow vacation accrual, until he asked for copies of his contract - only then did they admit their error.  He was later incorrectly instructed to submit hours for holidays via his normal time sheet as if he had worked that day.

Vacation days?  There is no system available to contract employees to verify their accrual.  To both see and utilize available vacation, one must do so via email with a representative.

If you have the misfortune of having no other options but to work for these people, just DON'T accept the health benefits.

name: Zac Carnea
text: Do whatever you can to avoid this scam of a agency

name: Tina Brom
text: Owner Vickie searches her database for jobs that fit within your work experience or those you may even be interested in.  She is honest about what the job offers entail.  If you are committed to working and looking for a job this is a great place to start.  Give her honesty about problems you may have had and no judgment.  Her job is to help you find work SUCCESSFULLY and she’s definitely accomplished this.

name: Jana Warren
text:
Wish i could make out a negative five stars.
You pay for your own background check and drug test,  and if for some reason you don't stay for 90 days,  we take another $150 out of your check. All they want is money.  Not to mention you can't even get a copy of the paperworkyou signed.  No matter what,  they care about money first, not their employees. They fire you though a text, and the temp service was going to deny me the chance to go to Arlington to bury my father. no compassion.  no communication.  trust me don't work for them.  it's basically a scam.

name: Desiree Paxton
text: Not professional. The lady I talked to on the phone hung up on me all because I asked her alittle bit about the job she was offereing, isn’t that a pretty common question? If you don’t want people asking questions about a potential job they will be doing then don’t post on indeed saying CALL NOW!! Because 9 out of 10 people are going to ask questions. I don’t know how anybody else up there is but one thing is for sure she is RUDE

text: If in could give less stars I would. Vickey who i imagine is an owner or married in is unresponsive and unprofessional. Also wouldn't return my calls or texts after a few days and has been rude and even yelling over me when trying to speak with her.  I suggest another company to go with. text: this place tries to take advantage of you in anyway they can. when i went up there to get my check they had two diffrent amounts on the same check these people are terrible dont go through Griffin i wish i could give them less than one star.

name: Mintrel Stewart
text: One of the worse experience I have ever Experienced from a recruiter. Not only did Rodney contact me and not make it known he was from a temp service, he was beyond rude to me for not accepting a job offer that was not worth my value. The job is located almost a hour from me so my pay requirement was more than fair on top of that the company did not have enough positive reviews for me to trust a 90 days probationary period. As a recruiter your job is to help not only the company to find the best employee but is also to help the employee find a good fit. You don't get mad because they have a family to take care of and cant just accept any pay. Instead of Rodney saying he was going get back with the company and see what he can do, he instantly attack me with verbal insults such as " your not going find a job for a long time with your pay requirement" voice got very high and disrespectful meanwhile I had him on speaker and other people could hear the conversation as well. I did not argue with him, but he hung the phone up in my face. Very rude and should not be a recruiter for anyone, he told me so many lies about the job and when I asked for proof of benefits and other things he kept giving me the run around. When I showed up to the job the person I was suppose to speak to wasn't even there, so I had to interview with Another person instead.

resp.text: I apologize you had a bad experience. After looking deeper into this situation, it appears it was obviously an oversight on my part to authorize your resume to be considered for this position. I have made the proper correction with Rodney to ensure he keeps his professionalism and I have also educated him as well on proper edicate dealing with a more professional and a higher class range of pay as you such deserve. Once again, I personally apologize this opportunity was not the exact fit you expected and deserve.

I handed these people my resume a month ago and they didn’t do anything for me. I eventually found a job on my own though. I heard from someone that used to work there that there is a lot of prejudice and racial biases going on there. She said that if you’re white, then you’re considered low priority. I don’t know if that’s true but from my personal experience, it seems to be.

There are better temp agencies than this one. You’d better off a place that treats everyone fairly regardless of race.

EDIT: I just realized the owner responded, but they do not allow replies. That is a straight up lie on their part. Not once did anyone call me. Racist AND Liars.

resp.text: Ian, I'm sorry you had a poor experience. It looks like one of our recruiters reached out about a job that you had no interest in. We pride ourselves in creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for every associate that walks through the door. Unfortunately we don't always have a position available that's a perfect fit for every candidate we interview.

text: I had gone to express services looking for employment however they told me that I would be sent out 2 a job with my qualifications as soon as they opened up that was a lie. They turn around and sent me to Technicolor where they treat all the employees as slaves you're not allowed to speak and they treat you really bad they scream at you and yell at you then they even have people that are on work release programs working in there with you being dropped off by the paddy wagons. As well they also have illegal aliens and minors working and their locations. Also when I started the project I was promised a certain amount of money an hour but I looked at my pay stub and I was missing money I was getting paid less hourly than what we had talked about when I mentioned it to my recruiter she turn around and got real nasty with me and told me that if I didn't like it I can quit and when I told her well I would quit but I need my money she turn around and tell me how about I fire you then so when I turn around and tell her well you know this conversation is being recorded by the way off my phone for your information and also I will be contacting my lawyers and I also have a copy of the contract by Express services which we had a green all of a sudden there was a silent pause and then they told me to come pick up my new check that it was going to be printed out. I will never recommend the staffing agency for anybody as well I do not want the owner or recruiter to reply back to me apologizing for any inconvenience because they are lucky I didn't contact the Better Business Bureau and I haven't called ice or immigration.

resp.text: Glidden,  Unfortunately, our Industrial team were only filling Technicolor jobs open on the day that you stopped in to find work.  I do apologize that it was not a good experience.  I can assure you that everyone that we send to Technicolor has been verified and is eligible to work in the US.  I can also assure you that we do not run any type of social service programs but I do know that these programs are in place to help others secure employment.  I am also very surprised that someone in my office spoke to you in the manner that you stated.  We truly appreciate every employee that works for us.

name: Playboy_Trey
text: I think they do a terrific job. I read some other reviews and don’t really feel the same way, although everyone is entitled to their opinion and all of us have different experiences, but as far as my experience with Express is concerned, they constantly tried to help me with job openings. Catered to my interests, and seemed genuinely interested in matching me with the right job as well. So I’m going to give them 5 stars, and it’s because  I really don’t know what more you’d expect from a temp agency. Maybe people expect things to happen faster than what’s possible. I get that, but patience is usually required when it comes to finding a decent job. So I can’t knock them for anything at all really. I would recommend them to others, and I would definitely work with them again in the future, if needed. Great company and service.

name: Ken Jackson
text: I guess I should have read the reviews on this place first because they are no better than the Express in Birmingham. First off, they never like to answer their phones nor respond to emails. I dealt with Sarah (who I’m assuming is the worse recruiters they have!) and she literally told me “I didn’t think that email needed a response to it,” After i sent her a few emails trying to get some form of contact back. Why would you say that?! At least respond acknowledging that you saw it because the receptionist doesn’t believe in answering the phone! Also, they WILL try to downplay your resume regardless of experience or if you have degrees. They try to put you in an irrelevant job to your current experience or try to give you an $8-$10 job! Lord forbid you ask for a higher pay because then they definitely can’t help you and will come up with some bull like “we’ll have to discuss your resume with the manager and see what will best fit you.” They are hard to communicate with and once I told Sarah what I was trying to do or look for she sent me a text for other job agencies and never contacted me again! By phone nor email! Express, do not give me this cookie cutter response saying Sarah is one of your best recruiters because obviously that’s a lie! You all are use to dealing with people who just walk in the door who aren’t dressed for interviews (and i have witnessed this on my way out the door!) and act like they never had any home training so you treat everyone who comes in the door like that! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME IF YOU’RE LOOKING FOR AN ACTUAL JOB/CAREER!

resp.text: Hey Ken, sorry you had such a negative experience. We work very hard to place as many people as we can at the highest paying positons possible but in the end we are only 1 resource of many that is available for you. If we do not have a position that suits your preferences, we will always share other resources that may be able to help you. We hope you are able to use them along with your network of connections to find a great job.

resp.text: Hi Amber, we understand how crucial finding a job in a timely manner is. The time that it takes to find something does vary depending on our clients' needs and the skillsets of our candidates. During a job search, our team uses all available resources to connect people with opportunities as soon as they become available. Because each candidate's job search and availability can change so quickly, our office wanted to confirm that you were still looking for work. We're sorry to hear the positions we presented in the past did not interest you. We hope you find a new opportunity that fits your career and wish you the best.

text: This was the most unprofessional tempt service I ever worked for. They send you ratchet jobs and when you complain about them they stop helping you. text: I have never worked for or with a staffing agency before and this experience didn;t boost my confidence. I was offered employment but was not advised of the correct hours until after my interview & after the company wanted to hire me. I was not able to work the hours so i had to decline the offer. The 2nd job offer was a perfect fit, after being misinformed by not just one but two staffing employees then being ran around about my direct deposit, having to take the drug test on site while at work with the employee sitting in there with me. Then the employer was not held responsible for not properly going over policy with me, lied to me about the "assignment ending". I tried all weekend to get to get someone on the phone in regards to what happened, they all told me "Call me anytime you need me" yet ignored all my calls. I then had to drive all the way to their office to be told why i was let go which was legit junk based on the EMPLOYERS negligence. I have now been without a job for over a month and the staffing agency apparently only has one job opening per employee and seeing as i had been let go from the one job they had available i have not heard a peep from them. I thought staffing places provided jobs and this place has absolutely nothing. Ever since I have came in contact with them it's just been chaos and stress. They don't care about the people they "employee" only themselves.

name: Rose Blevins
text: The first day I walked into the staffing agency I was greeted professionally and friendly by Brian at the front desk. I inquired about employment and he gave me more information than I expected. More than any staffing agency I had been to because for some reason, they act like giving employment info is a secret and you have to be initiated first to get any help. Brian made me feel like he was actually interested in helping me find employment. The Registration process was easy. I came back the next day to complete everything because I had an appointment. I meet with other staff members Shannon and Johnny. They too were friendly, kind, and professional. Just like Brian, with them, I also felt like they genuinely wanted to help me. I haven't felt like that about a staffing agency in a VERY long time. While I was there, I also noticed the way Brian interacted and talked to other job seekers that came into the office. The same way he treated me, with respect, professionalism, care, and a positive attitude. That really won me over and stood out in my mind. I also followed up with Sandra over the phone and she displayed the same professionalism that I encountered with the other staff at Elwood. I was blown away! She was so helpful when I called. I truly recommend Elwood staffing to any job seeker that is looking for employment. They really make you feel like they care about helping you when you walk in the door. They have what other staffing agencies lack these days, GREAT customer service!

resp.text: Rose- Thank you for sharing your review about your experience with Elwood Staffing. We are so glad we could be of help to you. Please let us know if there's anything more we can do to be of help.

name: Chris Walker
text:
I was working for the Montgomery office, but I put in my two weeks and I will never work with this company again. The lady I was working with was great, but she moved to a different state for a better job and the person who took over in her stead (Sheri), absolutely was not doing her job and wasn't letting me know when the employer wanted me to work.

I spoke to the employer directly and they told me they asked for me 2 or 3 different times and this lady didn't notify me of their request every time like she should have. I notified her that I contacted the employer directly to make sure that the correct info was being communicated, since I didn't trust that she was doing her job. They told me they didn't know why she wasn't notifying me of their E-Mails. She then told me I am NOT to contact the employer in any way, because Career Personnel was my boss and not the employer they work through.

While I understand that and normally wouldn't go around someone's back, communication is important. Anyway, it's completely immature and sketchy that they would even ask me not to contact the employer in any way, as I have never had an issue with this before when I worked for a staffing agency in another state. Seems to me like there was something to hide or protect on her/their behalf and either way you look at it, this lady wasn't looking out for my best interest. Completely unprofessional.

In closing, I just want to say, you don't TELL another adult what they can and can't do, as if you are in control of that individual. You are their boss, not God. Disrespect people and treat them that way, as if you you are entitled to have power over them and your business is going to crash.

Not only was my experience awful after this experience, but these folks absolutely put ZERO effort in to finding me a proper job placement that fit my skills and what I was educated to do. They just wanted the easy money from the quickest job placement they could find.

PEACE!

resp.text:
I am disappointed that your experience with us was not good for you. The entire team at Career Personnel works very hard to make a great match for both candidate and client and it gives us great pleasure to assist in the success of our candidates. Unfortunately, for various reasons this is not always possible. Due to your dissatisfaction I have reviewed the details of your employment through us and find the following:

We placed you with (2) clients from April 2019 through July 2019. You were assigned to the first client through us on 04/15/2019. Your assignment was ended on 04/17/2019 due to tardiness on both days and inability to focus on the job while there. The client was very flexible and had adjusted your start time to accommodate you but you were still unable to report on-time.

We placed you with the second client on 05/06/2019. The following incidents occurred:
05/16/19 - Late
05/21/19 - Left early for a personal matter
05/24/19 - Sick
05/28/19 - Sick
05/30/19 - Sick
05/31/19 - Sick
06/04/19 - Sick
06/05/19 - Late
06/06/19 - Sick
06/13/19 - Forgot to plug in phone and missed alarm - missed work
06/17/19 - Flat tire
06/28/19 - Sick
07/03/19 - Sick
This totals 13 days of available work missed.

Also, from 04/04/19 to 07/02/19 your contact number changed 3 times. We failed to contact you on one occasion on 06/11/2019 due to having the incorrect phone number updated in our software. We apologized for that and made the correction to your phone number.

During this time you had been contacting our client directly and we asked you not to do so as the client makes contact directly with us when they have a need. You agreed that this process was appropriate and that the client had told you the same thing on 06/25/19. On 07/03/19 we had to remind you again that you were not to contact the client directly. It was at this point that you became upset and tendered your notice.

In regards to not being able to assist you with a placement that aligned with your certification that was earned at Virginia College in 2015. We did not have any opportunities at the time to be able to place someone in this field particularly since you had no "on-the-job" experience that most of our clients require.

In retrospect; we believe that we have done everything possible to work with you and in reviewing the text messages we also find that you were treated with respect and courtesy by all recruiters. We wish you well in your future endeavors and hope that you have been able to secure a job that aligns with everything you were looking for.

name: C “Roses” Prater
text: Staff is amazing at placing you correctly.

name: Andrea Alston
text:
If you are in desperate need of  a job this is not the place.They are very nice and eager to find you a job in the beginning. ( at least thats what it seem like) I was very fooled by this company I was getting job offers from other companies and this company took 4 months to run a background I have worked in a few professional management settings this was beyond ridiculous.  I even went to the county where the background was stuck in . The office management was getting an attitude with me because I was calling trying to get an update.  To be clear  I did have something on my background that was over 7 years ago I was very honest and upfront with the staff. This has not ever  hinder me from obtaining a job as I have worked in management for over 2 0
years. I was beyond disappointed on how I was handle with the Management staff at this establishment.

name: Mur Lock
text: Filled out all their info. Got called about a few positions. After they got  allll my information- never.heard.from.again! This seems to be a trend in these temp to hire type agencies. I will email asking my file be deleted as they wasted my time.

name: Valentin Diaz
text: This labor finder is my favorite, but they dont pay the labor workers. They make about $20 an hour for the labor and they will pay the labor about $8 an hour. Its a rip off. I know this because i have talked to some company owners who get workers from them. I hear other labor finders pay better but they still rip off labor workers.

name: Keith Clarke
text: If you work here... keep in mind... any job you do on state owned property has minimum pay requirement of over $10 per hour... i had to contact the labor board and wait 6 month to be reimbursed for back pay... but i got it... if labor finders was lucky enough to not get a BIG fine for this... they will not get away with it again... so if you are working on state owned property... STAND UP FOR YOURSELF... this is the second time ive had to report labor finders for this kind of thing... the last time was in southern california where the minimum pay requirment was over $40 per hour... and they were paying me $10... companies like this make a fortune treating their workers like slave labor... sending you out on $15+ an hour jobs and paying McDonalds wages.... you are NOT beasts of burden... you deserve a fare wage for a hard days work... FIGHT FOR IT... your welcome by the way Tami... i always worked my ars off... never got bad reports... and had you payed me a descent wage... youd STILL have a good employee... instead you pay b.s. wages... and cant understand why you get b.s. workers... 20 years ago labor finders payed $8 $9 and $10 an hr for jobs... when it costed 1/4 as much to live... now you greedy p.o.s. pay less? Really... Karma is a BTCH... i hope they fined you a fortune...

name: Hugh Bailey
text: I had to go here for a TWIC card that my employer required. My appointment was for right when they opened but I got there almost 30min early. As soon as the first person was there they said they could get me in early. The facility was very clean, well furnished, everyone dressed and spoke very professionally and the front desk associate was extremely attentive. I was greeted (not called back) in the waiting room by the lady did did my application. She was quick, courteous and to the point. When we were done she escorted me out. The card was in my hands in just a few days. I was very impressed with the entire experience.

name: Heather Meeks
text: This place is SO awful.  Do not use them!  I was forced to use them because the college program that I am in requires background checks and urine drug tests for admission and they use ESS.  First of all it is day 12 and they do not have my background check back!  I have called their customer service multiple times and each day they tell me "it will be back today" or contradict themselves by saying "we have to make sure the information is correct."  Finally, an employee of the college department had to call them and guess what the hold up is...they needed confirmation on my middle name.  You think you could have asked me that one of the SIX times I called you?!  Also, another classmate had been waiting 7 days for a drug test to come back-the school had to call them only to find out that they neglected to send it.  And we got to spend $72.00 for this lovely "service."  The school (who is a huge client of theirs obviously) is extremely irritated with them as well and I wouldn't be surprised if they go with a different provider in the future.  EISI is also in the Birmingham area and does the same service nationwide and will do it cheaper (like 50% cheaper) and quicker.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PLACE.

name: B C
text:
UNETHICAL AND GREEDY. This company scams and over-charges their customers. Companies and individuals should STAY AWAY from this company.
I had a background check performed for myself and employee. ESS decided to search the middle name and last name of myself and my employee in an effort to make more money.
This search was not justified and, as expected, no records came up in a middle name/last name search for myself or my employee.
Then, I receive an invoice (already charged to my credit card) for 5 total name searches.
Searching for aliases is understandable and I would not object to this, but they arbitrarily decided to perform unnecessary name searches and charge us for them.
I have had background checks for myself and employee performed 3 years ago for the same program, and the other company did not unnecessarily search for middle name/last name because they knew that it was unethical.
I can not stress this enough, STAY AWAY from ESS! They WILL scam you.

text:
I interviewed with Laura Hill,  she was an excellent person to work with. She is well mannered, extremely nice, and she tries her best to help.  However,  the receptionist has a very poor attitude, rude,  and her not very good around people.  The receptionist certainly needs a job with minimal interactions with people,  but instead she's the face of this staffing agency.  I was supposed to have some tests emailed to me on Monday, I never got them,  I called today  (Wednesday) to ask about them and the receptionist was extremely inconsiderate and ill because I was at my job and wasn't able to call them and inquire about the tests I didn't receive. Even though I do not work for them and I never have. She said I was a no call- no show.

If you can avoid this place you should.  I honestly think the receptionist is there to sabotage job applicants.  If get attitude doesn't run you off, her terrible work ethic will ensure that you will not be working for them.

name: Zakarias McDanal
text: I am a Junior Mobile developer looking for a position so I figured I would give ITAC a shot. I valued them due to the many tech meet-ups hosted there which I attended and the friendly personality each member seems to have. However, it seems like their personality and willingness to help is about as fake as a car salesman’s. I’ve tried to use their services twice now and have gotten as far as to schedule phone calls after phone calls but each time, I’m blown off and ghosted. I’ve even delayed myself a few times from going into work just to be able to schedule a call with a recruiter only to be blown off and given an excuse of he/she having a “super busy day”. To sum up this review, if you are expecting these recruiters to care about you - they don’t. Will they help you? Not if you’re a junior developer.

text:
ITAC helped me find my current job, and I’m so happy with it! They’re unlike any recruiting/ staffing company because they truly care and want to find something that would be a great fit for you.
They set up a meeting with you first to get to know you/ get a vibe of the kind of person you are and really get a feel of what you’re looking for- which really stood out to me. I really connected with the girl helping me, and she’s been in touch often to make sure sure I’m still loving it. I’m so grateful for my experience with ITAC!

name: Ryan Johnson
text: I had a fabulous experience as a job seeker at ITAC. Wes kept me informed on opportunities and had me prepared for each interview. Lots of solid communication, and I ended up getting a fantastic job. God forbid I’m looking for a job again in the near future, but if I am the first thing I’m doing is calling ITAC.

name: Anna Beard
text: IDK if she still works there or not but do NOT trust Jennifer. If you have a job already be very weary before accepting a position. She will tell you anything to get you signed on somewhere to make her cut, no matter if there is any truth in it on not. I told her I didn't want a temp position, she assured me that it wasn't going to be and that it would roll perm. The company she placed me with kept me 5 days and then let me go without explanation other than I wasn't a good fit. My whole experience with ITAC was terrible. Thankfully, I was able to get my old job back. It has been a year since this happened but this still bothers me and I don't want anyone to go through what I did.

name: Jess w
text:
I would rate Leslie and the ITAC team a 10!!!

Leslie did a fantastic job. She found my resume online and reached out to me directly. She made the process easy and effective.

She gave me feedback on my resume and was in touch with me through every step of the way. My first phone call interview was successful and each time I spoke with the hiring manager I heard back from my recruiter within the hour. Even when there was an hour or two delay on the employers end, my recruiter was prompt to follow up and ensure the appointment was still going to happen.

She even went above and beyond my first week on the job, which was also the week that snow and Ice covered the roads, by assisting me with the agreement and application paperwork so that I was able to start two weeks earlier than originally requested. That was a good reassuring feeling to have! Also, when I had questions pertaining to the direct deposit process she was available directly and was always prompt, friendly & efficient each time.

For anyone looking for assistance with a job hunt- Call Leslie at ITAC!

name: Connie Dockery
text:
I am enjoying my assignment as a Technical Writer.  My experience with ITAC has been wonderful from the first time I spoke with my recruiter, Chancelor Dinkins.

Chance has been professional as a recruiter and has been a pleasure to get to know and work with.  About a month after our first conversation, Chance called me to discuss my current position.  He kept me informed as to where we were in the contract process and answered any questions I asked.

I would definitely recommend ITAC Solutions to a friend or colleague.   I would also recommend Chance as a Recruiter.  He works diligently to ensure he has the right fit for his client.

name: Katrice Edwards
text: Ginny Queen 👑 is an awesome and sweet person that really care about you finding a job.  Ginny helped me find a job 2 days after my interview. Its is a really good company to go to when looking for entry level jobs. Look over the negative comments and give ITAC Solutions a try.

name: Kaynen Pellegrino
text: I went in for an interview, explain to my interviewer how I had used payroll software them the pastAnd had to correct payroll due to under pain. Not that I had given extra money, but that I had given the money that they were originally supposed be paid in the first place. I was then told that that is against management, ensuring that your employees were paid what they worked. If this company supports under paying their employees, or represent any companies that do, I don’t feel that they’re who you want to work for. Go somewhere where you’re not punished for ensuring employees are paid correctly.

name: Scott Blair (Scott the Wheelman)
text: ITAC Mobile, AL team is great to work with!  They know just how to match candidate and employer together for a great fit!  I recommend their office to anyone seeking opportunity in the Mobile area.

name: Suzanne McCreedy, Esq.
text: J G Carver is the best! He is super nice, very professional, and always willing to answer any questions. This was my first time working with a contracting company, and it was a really good experience.

name: Uri Nystrom
text: The staff was very nice professional and very eager to find an appropriate job for me. However, once they found the perfect job it went downhill quickly. I had to take a test for the position but none of the computers worked properly with the program. I was able to take it from home but it took almost 3 hours to finish. Then I never heard back after countless emails and phone calls. I found several other suitable jobs on their website but was never contacted after expressing interest. Also, you cannot submit your resume in PDF form which is silly this day and age.

name: Nneka Walker
text:
Let it be known that Ginny Queen is the BOMB! I jumped between several temp agencies the past year, and I joined ITAC in late Nov. I have a Master's degree, so Ginny REFUSED to give me a job that pays less than $15/hr. It took maybe a wk or two when she called me about a position that pays $16/hr (the most I ever made in my LIFE). Ginny called me about an hr after my interview with the company to let me know I got the job! The job was initially temporary, only lasting 2 mths. Ginny kept in touch with me periodically to make sure I was happy and to get updates. None of the other agencies I went through has EVER done that for me, and it made me really happy that Ginny cared. Now it's four mths later, and I was offered a full-time position with that company today! I worked hard, followed Ginny's advice, and made a great impression with the company to make them decide to keep me! I'm ecstatic right now, knowing that this would not have been possible without ITAC and especially Ginny! Thanks so much for everything, Ginny!

P.S. ITAC has a BEAUTIFUL office! Their interior designer did an amazing job!

name: Heather Smith
text: Rachel Smith is an amazing recruiter and found me my dream job! Definitely recommend ITAC to all my friends and family :)

name: Garrett Blair
text: I met with a recruiter here in the late summer of 2015. I went in a couple of times to meet with them for a position, but never anything specific. I never received any kind of communication from them on any open position after my original meeting. My background is extremely flexible and fits with many types of positions. I understand that recruiters get busy and sometimes candidates fall through the cracks, but now the same thing is happening to a friend who is working with ITAC. She received an email from a recruiter here. She applied to an Admin position since that is the majority of her experience. When the call came to speak with her, he completely blew past it and focused in on her weaknesses and said that she would not be a fit for the position that she applied for through them. As a Recruiting Manager myself, I would submit her resume for that position left and right. In short, I would not waste your valuable time working with this company. Instead, look at other firms, like PangeaTwo or Moxy. These companies work hard for their candidates.

name: Nathan Herum
text: I had a great experience. ITAC found me when I wasn't even looking for a job. The opportunity they found for me is a great fit, and I'm so glad that with their help I was able to make the jump and try something new.

name: Mathew Woodyard
text:
I worked with two different recruiting firms in the Birmingham area and I'm literally giving the same review on both. They were that similar in experience. I give them two stars out of five because while there were no results for myself, I still understand the process however, but feel it could be better.

You must first understand these recruiting firms are not really working for you, but are working for their business clients. So even though they give you a nice, warm speech about how they are here for you, in reality assisting you is secondary to assisting their paying clients. This is somewhat fair because that is how they make their money.

Again, experience was very similar at the two firms I visited. You fill out paperwork, which is basically like completing a employment application. You will be scheduled to come in for an interview so they can go over your employment history and get a feel for the type of job you are seeking. They are also using this meeting to "pre-interview" you for their clients. Staff at all two locations were very nice and friendly. The recruiters are very bubbly and fun.

At the end of the meeting, the recruiters will tell you how they will get to work attempting to place you with a matching career with one of their clients. This is kinda where the communication stopped for me. Beyond this initial interview, I received no communication in the following three months. The only call I did receive (from one firm), was a few days after visiting to tell me a job I was initially matched with had changed the job description and the pay scale was well below what I was seeking. Barring that single contact, radio silence. I was even told by one firm that after submitting my info to a place or two they would follow up with me regardless of the results to let me know how things were progressing. That call was not received.

I am sure the firms have worked well for some, just not for me.

name: David Schmitt
text: Beware.  Calls may go unanswered for days, disconnects, blind transfers.  My experience with them was very unprofessional.  If you are looking for a serious recruiting firm concerned with helping you find a high paying career, this is probably not the company for you.

name: j guil
text: I wish I would have left this review sooner. I cannot remember the name of the Male recruiter that I interviewed with, but simply put...HE SUCKED!!! I wouldn't say avoid the company altogether as with all staffing agencies you will eventually run into a bad experience with a recruiter or two. ITAC didn't work for me at all as the recruiter could care less about what I was looking for in a job. He kept pushing the kind of work that I  initially told him I didn't want to do and when I would agree to do the work because it seemed like he wasnt finding anything else, he would tell me they didn't want me or they went in a different direction. I told him that I wanted to steer clear of call centers as they just were not my cup of tea and the two jobs he tried to sell me on were call center jobs at lower rates than the ones I had in the past... Pangeatwo found a job that fit what I like to do but the pay isnt great although it does help to pay the bills... As I said earlier, all staffing agencies are the same but your experience is yours alone. You have to just keep searching until you find what fits what it is you feel works best for you...

This company is not the worst but its not the best either.

name: Nimitz 17
text:
I agreed with Snelling to take a 2nd shift position. After a few months on the job I was then told I was being moved to 3rd shift by the company. And it was a “You get off when the job is done.” position. I called and talked with Snelling about the change that I didn’t want. I was then told to try and stick with it. If I didn’t like it then I’d have to give a week notice before I quit, they wouldn’t look for me something else till I quit, and there was no guarantee’s for another job position. Basically I’d have to risk being unemployed for weeks, possibly months. The fact that this was originally described as a 2nd shift position clearly didn’t matter. If temps are expected to keep their word. The same should be expected from their clients.

Edit: I told you’ll they changed my shift. And y’all refuse to even look for anything till I quit. So If you really meant “By all mean” you would have found me something before I quit. After all they didn’t keep their word. Instead im told that I needed to quit first. Another false statement. Y’all have shown more then ones that it’s all about the companies y’all send temps to. Y'all will have another temp lined up and ready to replace anybody the next day. But if the TEMP is done wrong y’all refuse to be so accommodating. The temp just gets the work or unemployment options. By all means? Yeah right!

resp.text:
We understand your frustration and would like to talk with you further.  We work hard to find the right fit for our candidates and clients.  If the client changed the shift then, by all means, we want to try and help you find something that will work better.  Please call our office again to speak with your recruiter or a Manager about the situation.  We appreciate the opportunity to improve our service and response.

Edit: While we can't change what happened or what was said by a particular team member, our team is still interested in speaking with you directly about the situation and trying to assist you.  Please contact a Snelling Manager at 205-879-9950.

text:
I went into the office and registered one day, and the very next day they already had an assignment for me.
